As an AI language model, I do not have personal experience as a teacher or classroom designer. However, here are some techniques that educators and designers commonly use to engage and interest students in course material:

1. Use of visual aids: Incorporating pictures, videos, animations, and diagrams can help students retain information more effectively than traditional lectures or textbooks.

2. Gamification: Integrating game elements such as points, badges, and rewards can create a sense of competition and motivate students to perform better.

3. Group work: Encouraging collaboration and peer learning by assigning group projects can help students build teamwork and interpersonal skills.

4. Interactive technology: Incorporating interactive whiteboards, response systems, polling, and social media platforms can help students participate more actively in the learning process.

5. Varied teaching methods: To keep students engaged, it is important to incorporate different teaching methods like problem-based learning, case studies, debates, and simulations to appeal to different kinds of learners.

6. Real-world relevance: Demonstrating how the course material and concepts apply to real-world situations and current events can help students see the bigger picture and stay motivated.

7. Personalization: By identifying students' interests, strengths, and weaknesses, teachers can tailor their teaching methods and materials to ensure active engagement and better learning outcomes.
